channel.title: International: Top News And Analysis
channel.description: CNBC International is the world leader for news on business, technology, China, trade, oil prices, the Middle East and markets.

item.title: China's bond market intervention reveals financial stability worries
item.description: The country's latest efforts to stem a bond market rally shows that authorities are worried about financial stability, analysts said.

item.title: Tencent-backed Airwallex nears $500 million annualized sales, aims to get IPO-ready by 2026
item.description: Payments startup Airwallex is nearing an annual revenue run rate of $500 million and will be ready for an IPO by 2026, CEO Jack Zhang told CNBC.

item.title: Bank of Japan will take longer to hike rates given the yen's rapid strengthening, BMI says
item.description: Following market turbulence, BOJ's Deputy Governor Uchida Shinichi released a statement affirming that the bank would not raise rates amid market instability.

item.title: China reports slight beat in July retail sales, but industrial data disappoint
item.description: Other data for July released in the last two weeks have indicated consumer demand remains sluggish.

item.title: Japan second-quarter GDP beats expectations, expands 0.8% from previous quarter
item.description: On a year-on-year basis, however, the country's GDP fell for a second straight quarter, down 0.8% after having declined 0.9% in the first quarter.

item.title: Starbucks is giving incoming CEO Brian Niccol $85 million in cash and stock as he departs Chipotle
item.description: Starbucks plans to pay incoming CEO Brian Niccol $10 million in cash and $75 million in equity awards when he joins the company from Chipotle.

item.title: CNBC Daily Open: Inflation battle is 'absolutely' done
item.description: The S&P 500 closed higher for the fifth straight session. The Dow Jones Industrial Average climbed 242 points, while the Nasdaq Composite eked out a 0.03% gain.

item.title: Schumer says a crypto bill can pass Senate this year; key Dems join 'Crypto4Harris' call
item.description: Top Democrats joined virtual town hall to back crypto and a Kamala Harris administration.

item.title: We drove Chinese EVs to see why rival automakers are worried
item.description: CNBC tested four EVs built by Chinese automakers to see how they stack up against the Tesla Model Y and why they inspire fear in rivals.

item.title: Wizz Air launches $550 'all you can fly' annual subscription pass
item.description: Travelers in Europe can now take unlimited flights for 499 euros ($550) a year under a new travel subscription service from budget carrier Wizz Air.

item.title: World's largest sovereign wealth fund posts $138 billion in first-half profit as AI demand boosts tech
item.description: Norway's massive sovereign wealth fund on Wednesday posted first-half profit of 1.48 trillion kroner ($138 billion).

item.title: Annual inflation rate slows to 2.9% in July, lowest since 2021
item.description: The consumer price index was expected to show a 0.2% increase in July and a 3% gain over the past year.

item.title: 'Pulling a Joe Biden': Reactions to Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida's resignation
item.description: One expert said the move was reminiscent of U.S. President Joe Biden dropping out of the presidential race less than a month ago.

item.title: How Elliott's monthslong Starbucks campaign got it a better deal than it asked for
item.description: Elliott's biggest win this year may be at Starbucks, beginning with private discussions and ending with a CEO change that investors and activists cheered.

item.title: Why NASA astronauts are waiting to return on Boeing's Starliner
item.description: Boeing's Starliner capsule "Calypso" has been in space for 71 days and counting as the company and NASA try to identify whether its safe for its crew to return.

item.title: Trump packs economic speech with personal attacks on Harris
item.description: The speech came as the Trump campaign retools its message after President Joe Biden withdrew his reelection bid and endorsed Harris as his replacement.

item.title: A U.S. construction boom is sending rents lower and creating perks for renters
item.description: Newly built apartment buildings are helping increase the supply of available rental units in some parts of the country. The result? Price cuts and added perks.

item.title: Britain considers tougher internet safety laws after riots, Musk comments — what you need to know
item.description: The U.K. is considering ways to toughen up internet safety regulations after far-right riots sparked by misinformation and incendiary comments from Elon Musk.

item.title: Google's live demo of Gemini ramps up pressure on Apple as AI reaches smartphone users
item.description: While Google's live demo on Tuesday had some bugs, the company showed it's closer than its rivals to bringing artificial intelligence to smartphones.

item.title: Reddit's increased reliance on Google traffic has Wall Street anxious to see if visitors sign up
item.description: Reddit is currently benefiting from a Google search update, but it's unclear how well the company will attract new users excited enough to create accounts.

item.title: Chinese tech giant Tencent's quarterly profit jumps 82% as key gaming unit accelerates
item.description: Tencent shares are up 27% this year, in part due to excitement around a new game called Dungeon & Fighter Mobile (DnF Mobile).

item.title: Biden hosts first Creator Economy Conference for influencers to talk AI, privacy and more
item.description: President Joe Biden recently signed a law to potentially ban TikTok, the China-based social site that has dominated the content-creation industry.

item.title: UBS CEO says it's too early to talk about a U.S. recession, but a slowdown is possible
item.description: UBS CEO Sergio Ermotti said market volatility could intensify in the second half of the year, but he does not believe the U.S. is heading into a recession.

item.title: UK inflation comes in below expectations at 2.2%, after two months at the Bank of England's 2% target
item.description: U.K. inflation came in below expectations at 2.2% in July, data from the Office for National Statistics showed Wednesday.

item.title: UBS smashes second quarter profit expectations as Credit Suisse consolidation boosts revenue
item.description: Analysts expected revenue of $11.5 billion, according to an LSEG poll.

item.title: France's 'Olympic truce' ends, returning political tensions to the fore
item.description: Emmanuel Macron must appoint a new prime minister but faces an "unprecedented" backdrop that may lead to deadlock.

item.title: Video game industry faces sluggish growth in 2024 amid weak console sales, research firm says
item.description: Market research firm Newzoo said the games industry is set to grow 2.1% year over year, down from its earlier forecast of 2.8% year-over-year growth.

item.title: Intel sells stake in UK chip designer Arm amid company-wide restructuring and cost cuts
item.description: Intel has sold its 1.18 million stake in British chip firm Arm Holdings, a regulatory filing showed on Tuesday, as the company cuts costs.

item.title: Reserve Bank of New Zealand cuts cash rate by 25 basis points, lowers rate forecasts
item.description: The Reserve Bank of New Zealand lowered its cash rate by 25 basis points to 5.25% on Wednesday.

item.title: Asia-Pacific markets mostly gain as RBNZ cuts cash rate; Japan's Prime Minister Kishida to step down
item.description: Separately, business sentiment at Japanese manufacturers have turned slightly less confident in August, according to the Reuters Tankan survey.
